name: MoveSectionInProject
description:
Reorder sections within a project in Asana.

Use this tool to move sections relative to each other within a single Asana project. Either 'before_section' or 'after_section' must be specified. This tool does not support moving sections between different projects.

parameters.name: project_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project in Asana.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: section_to_reorder
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the section to move within the project.

parameters.name: insert_before_section_id
parameters.description: Specify the section ID to place the given section immediately before it.

value_schema.description: Insert the given section immediately before the section specified by this parameter.

parameters.name: insert_after_section_id
parameters.description: The ID of the section after which the given section will be inserted. Specify to reorder sections within the same project.

value_schema.description: Insert the given section immediately after the section specified by this parameter.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: If true, enables pretty output with line breaks and indentation for readability. Use primarily for debugging, as it may increase response time and size.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: opt_pretty
parameters.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: project_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: data.before_section
parameters.description: Insert the given section immediately before the section specified by this parameter.

value_schema.description: Insert the given section immediately before the section specified by this parameter.

parameters.name: data.after_section
parameters.description: Insert the given section immediately after the section specified by this parameter.

value_schema.description: Insert the given section immediately after the section specified by this parameter.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
